recipe_name: Grilled Chicken with Lemon and Herbs
ingredients: Salt and black pepper, to taste
cooking_steps: Preheat grill to medium-high heat.
In a bowl, whisk together the garlic, parsley, basil, thyme, olive oil, salt, and black pepper.
Brush the chicken breasts with the herb mixture and place on the grill. Add the lemon slices to the grill as well.
Grill the chicken for 5-6 minutes per side, or until cooked through.
Remove the chicken and lemon slices from the grill and let rest for 5 minutes.
Serve the chicken with the grilled lemon slices and additional herbs, if desired.

ingredients: Salt and black pepper, to taste
cooking_steps: Melt the butter in a large pot over medium heat.
Add the onion and garlic and sauté for 2-3 minutes, or until softened.
Add the crushed tomatoes and chicken or vegetable broth. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and let simmer for 10-15 minutes.
Stir in the chopped basil and heavy cream. Cook for another 5 minutes.
Using an immersion blender or transferring to a blender in batches, puree the soup until smooth.
Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
Serve hot with crusty bread or croutons.

ingredients: 1 can (15 oz) chickpeas, drained and rinsed
cooking_steps: Preheat oven to 425°F.
In a large bowl, toss the cauliflower florets and chickpeas with the olive oil, cumin, smoked paprika, salt, and black pepper.
Spread the cauliflower and chickpeas on a baking sheet and roast for 20-25 minutes, or until tender and browned.
In a small bowl, whisk together the lemon juice and honey to make the dressing.
In a large bowl, toss the roasted cauliflower and chickpeas with the mixed greens, feta cheese, parsley, and dressing.
Serve immediately.

ingredients: 1 lb large shrimp, peeled and deveined
Salt and black pepper, to taste
cooking_steps: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Cook the spaghetti according to package instructions, until al dente.
Meanwhile, preheat a grill or grill pan to medium-high heat.
In a bowl, whisk together the pesto, olive oil, garlic, red pepper flakes, salt, and black pepper.
Add the shrimp to the bowl and toss to coat in the pesto mixture.
Grill the shrimp for 2-3 minutes per side, or until pink and cooked through.
Drain the pasta and reserve 1 cup of the cooking water. Toss the pasta with the remaining pesto mixture and add enough of the reserved cooking water to create a creamy sauce.
Divide the pasta between serving plates and top with the grilled shrimp, Parmesan cheese, and fresh basil.
Serve hot.

ingredients: 1 block (14 oz) firm tofu, drained and cubed
cooking_steps: Heat 1 tbsp of vegetable oil in a large wok or skillet over high heat.
Add the tofu and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes, or until golden brown. Remove the tofu from the wok and set aside.
Add the remaining 1 tbsp of vegetable oil to the wok. Add the bell peppers, onion, and broccoli and stir-fry for 3-4 minutes, or until tender-crisp.
Add the garlic and ginger to the wok and stir-fry for 1-2 minutes, or until fragrant.
In a small bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, cornstarch, and water.
Add the tofu and soy sauce mixture to the wok and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened and everything is heated through.
Garnish with chopped green onions and serve hot with rice.
Preheat the oven to 400°F.
In a shallow dish, combine the panko bread crumbs, Parmesan cheese, garlic powder, onion powder, paprika, salt, and black pepper.
In another shallow dish, beat the eggs.
Dip each chicken tender first in the beaten eggs, then coat in the panko mixture.
Place the chicken tenders on a greased baking sheet and lightly spray with cooking spray.
Bake for 15-20 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the coating is crispy and golden brown.
Serve hot with your favorite dipping sauce.
